the-hermit.name: Melted ‚ñ™ The Light of Inner Wisdom and Spiritual Travel
the-hermit.short_description: The melt card is a symbol of inner search, of loneliness, of wisdom and spiritual enlightenment, trust in the power of silence, and find your way in your own light.

upright.general: The melt represents a time of introvertion in your life, listening to yourself, and a deep inner discovery, and you can find peace in loneliness, away from the noise of the outside world, and you can discover your true guidance in your inner light. This card tells you to be your own guide on the path of patience, maturity, and life.
upright.love: In love, Ermi means temporary distance, individual space needs, or internal interrogations. If you are alone, this process is an opportunity for you to get to know yourself and learn from past relationships. In current relationships, mutual understanding and individual development are important.
upright.career: In the field of career, the Ermis card points to a time when it is appropriate to make its own way, to work independently, or to become a mentor. Instead of hasty decisions, strategic thinking and sticking to personal values are prerequisite.
upright.money: In material matters, it is an ideal time for reviewing, saving, and building long-term plans, and it advises to avoid hasty material matters and give priority to inner peace.
upright.spiritual: Spiritually, the melt card represents meditation, inner silence, and the search for spiritual guidance, and when you're alone with yourself, you can open the gates of universal wisdom and inner peace.

reversed.general: Inversion means extreme loneliness, introvertion, or lack of guidance. Even if it's beneficial to be drawn into yourself, being completely separated from the people around you can lead to a breakdown of the spiritual balance. Maintain your connection with the outside world for a balanced internal search.
reversed.love: In reverse position in love is a risk of insulating yourself from relationships, of emotional coldness or lack of communication, and try to strengthen their bond with open communication and understanding.
reversed.career: In the career, a lack of isolation or guidance from working alone can cause a blockage in projects.
reversed.money: Financially, overconservative or unnecessary concerns can prevent financial flow. It's important to take advantage of reliable advice and find balance.
reversed.spiritual: In a spiritual sense, it points to the risk of getting away from lack of guidance, loneliness, or inner enlightenment, reconnecting with meditation and spiritual communities.

context.mythology: Ermish is the archetype of ancient scholars, dervishes and hermits. In mythology, it is identified with figures who retreat to the cave or seek wisdom alone at the top of the mountain. Like the teachings of the ancient Tzu, the journey of Ermish represents the search for both personal and universal wisdom.

celtic_cross.future: In the near future, you may need to explore internally or rely solely on your own guidance, which will bring spiritual growth and clarity.
celtic_cross.hidden_influences: The hidden effects illuminate the path of inner insights and past experiences, and the wisdom in your subconscious shapes your decisions.

story.title: The Spiritual Journey of Ermish
story.description: And he shall walk in the darkness with a lantern in his hand, and light the light of the lantern, that he may guide his way and others: and loneliness is not a weakness unto him, but the door of wisdom and inner peace; and in every step, he shall be cleansed of the confusion of the outside world, and draw near to the essence and universal truth.
story.history_message: Ermi≈ü represents wisdom, retreat, and inner guidance in Tarot's history. In the Middle Ages and Renaissance, he was portrayed as a wise man, monk, or recluse. His lantern is the light of the spirit that can find its way even in darkness.
story.mystic_title: Spiritual Message - The Power of Silence
story.mystic_message: The melt teaches you that silence and loneliness are an opportunity for spiritual growth, trust in inner guidance, answers will come to you in your own light.
story.cultural_title: Modern Comment: Internal Healer and Mentor
story.cultural_message: In the modern world, you come to us as a Ermi, an inner healer, a life coach, or a spiritual mentor, and you can set an example for others when you light your own path.
story.lesson: The melt teaches you to find your own inner light, to mature with patience and deep thought, and to enrich yourself with travel, silence, and loneliness.

keywords.positive_message: Inner wisdom, guidance, patience, peace in solitude, spiritual enlightenment.
keywords.balance_message: Avoid extreme isolation; balance between loneliness and social ties.
keywords.soul_message: Answers are hidden deep within the silence and inner journey, find your way in your own light.

the-wheel-of-fortune.name: Wheel of Destiny (Changes and Cycles)
the-wheel-of-fortune.short_description: The Wheel of Destiny represents the cycles of life, change and fate, the return of fortune, new opportunities and surrender to the flow of life.

upright.general: The Wheel of Destiny represents the cyclical nature and change of life, and you're in a time when luck can turn and new opportunities can come, so let the flow and be open to change.
upright.love: Unforeseen developments in love and new opportunities, your destiny can lead you to a new relationship or transformation in the current relationship.
upright.career: Change in careers, new opportunities, positive developments, possible luck.
upright.money: Cycle changes in material matters, luck and opportunity are at hand, so be prepared.
upright.spiritual: Trust in the universe's plan and accept cycles.

reversed.general: The Reverse Destiny Wheel is about fighting bad luck, resistance, or change, and resisting flow can be a problem.
reversed.love: Unforeseen problems or cyclical difficulties in love, be patient and let it flow.
reversed.career: Career delays or unexpected changes, adapt instead of resisting.
reversed.money: Be careful with the financials, you may not get lucky right now.
reversed.spiritual: You may be mentally resistant to flow, learn to surrender.

context.mythology: In ancient mythology, the Wheel of Destiny represents the looming of the goddesses of fate and the cyclical nature of life. In Greek mythology, Moira ruled these cycles.

celtic_cross.future: In the future, you may experience significant changes and cyclical transformations.
celtic_cross.hidden_influences: It's about hidden influences, past loops and fate, the universe's plan that shapes you.

story.title: Wheel of Destiny (Dance of Cycles)
story.description: The card contains a wheel, sphinx, snake, and Anubis figure, which represents the cycles of life, the rise and fall, teaching to surrender to the course of fate and embrace change.
story.history_message: The Wheel of Destiny is one of Tarot's oldest symbols, depicting the cyclical nature of life in the Middle Ages with symbols of fate and luck.
story.mystic_title: Spiritual Meaning - Surrendering to the Stream
story.mystic_message: Spiritually, the Wheel of Destiny is to rely on the plan of the universe and surrender to the course of life, accept the cycles and be open to change.
story.cultural_message: In the modern world, the Wheel of Destiny represents luck, opportunity, and unexpected changes.
story.lesson: Accept the cycles of life, instead of resisting change, let it flow.

keywords.positive_message: Luck, new opportunities, positive change, cyclical development.
keywords.balance_message: Instead of resisting change, let it flow, be patient.
keywords.soul_message: Trust in the universe's plan, fate is taking you to the right place.

justice.name: Justice, Balance, Truth and Complicated Accounting
justice.short_description: The justice card represents the power of honesty, balance, and universal laws. Every action produces a response; the divine balance is always restored in life.

upright.general: The justice card says it's time to face the consequences of your decisions. See the facts, be honest, and take responsibility for your choices. A complex balance is about to be established. The universe is a fair and impartial scale; each action has an echo.
upright.love: In love, honesty and openness are the front line, facing real emotions is the balance of the relationship, and before you start a new relationship, you may need to free yourself from the ties of the past.
upright.career: It's important to stick to ethical values on the road to careers, where justice offers awards when making good decisions, and there may be improvements in business talks, contracts, or court processes.
upright.money: Financially, balanced spending and honest gains come first, avoid unfair gains, and the income you deserve will soon find you.
upright.spiritual: In a spiritual sense, justice represents a complex awakening, the results of your past steps are now balanced, the mental balance, the consciousness of self-responsibility.

reversed.general: Reverse Justice, injustice, imbalance, or not being honest with yourself, not confronting reality, delays spiritual growth, needs to restore internal scales.
reversed.love: In reverse positions in love, misunderstandings, unstable relationships, or emotional manipulation, suppressing the facts would undermine the trust of the relationship.
reversed.career: In working life, there may be injustice, unethical behavior, or misapprehension, be patient and be honest; time brings justice.
reversed.money: Be careful about financial matters; wrong investments or unfair gains can cause problems. Keep the money's energy clean.
reversed.spiritual: Spiritually reverse justice is a sign of not being honest with yourself or others, rebalance the scales of conscience.

context.mythology: Justice is identified with the goddesses of Themis and Maat in ancient mythology, and while Themis represents the divine laws, Maat is the voice of truth that maintains the order of the universe, and this card demands that you balance the laws of life with the scales of your heart.

celtic_cross.future: There's a process that will soon come true for you, and the truth will be revealed and the balance will be restored.
celtic_cross.hidden_influences: Mixed influences could be from the past, and now it's time to face honesty and learn your lesson.

story.title: The Mirror of Justice
story.description: The woman sitting on one throne holds the scales of the sword in one hand, and the sword in the other, and the truth and the sharp truth; and the scales represent the universal balance; and her eyes are open, because she is not afraid of the truth.
story.history_message: In Egypt, the heart, measured by the feather of Maat, determined the lightness of the spirit. In Rome, Themis maintained the divine order of human law. The card of justice combines these ancient symbols.
story.mystic_title: Spiritual Meaning - The Power of Honesty
story.mystic_message: The justice card teaches you to recognize spiritual responsibility, honesty is not just the word, it's the energy, it's the heart that is aligned with the truth.
story.cultural_message: Today, this card represents accepting the consequences of personal choices and sticking to ethical values, and the truth sets you free.
story.lesson: It teaches the importance of living with justice, honesty and inner balance, and every choice has an echo, and the universe brings that echo back fairly.

the-hanged-man.name: Hanged Man ‚ñ™ Surrender, Awareness and New View
the-hanged-man.short_description: The Hanged Man represents pauses, introverts, and looking at events from a different perspective, and sometimes the way to move forward is to stop and surrender.

upright.general: The hanging Man's card points to a period of waiting or suspended time in your life, not to punish you, but to deepen your awareness, to give up control and to see things in a different light, a spiritual rebirth.
upright.love: In love, it's time to look at your relationship from a different perspective, learn to wait, open your heart and patiently listen to your intuition, bring acceptance and understanding instead of old patterns.
upright.career: There may be a temporary recession in the field of careers, but this process is an opportunity for you to find your new direction, stopping, reassessing, and making conscious choices will bring growth.
upright.money: Financially, patience and strategic waiting are important, so instead of acting right now, focus on getting insight.
upright.spiritual: The Man Hanged spiritually teaches ego surrender and trust in divine flow, and true enlightenment comes when he can give up control.

reversed.general: The man who's hanging upside down shows resistance, stubbornness, or being closed to change, and if life stops you, maybe it's time you start thinking differently.
reversed.love: A reverse position in love can indicate a time when sacrifice is one-sided or an energy blockage of a relationship.
reversed.career: It's possible that there's been a cycle of disorientation or delay in the career, and moving forward without developing a new perspective will keep you in the same place.
reversed.money: If the old methods don't work, go to the new strategy.
reversed.spiritual: Spiritually, fear of surrender or insufferability can prevent inner peace, learn to trust the flow.

context.mythology: The hanging Adam archetype is associated with Odin's learning the secret of runes by hanging himself to Yggdrasil, in Scandinavian mythology. True wisdom is born from the courage to transform pain into awareness.

celtic_cross.future: In the future, a process that requires a pause or a change of direction may be waiting for you, and the waiting will be the key to awareness.
celtic_cross.hidden_influences: The unseen factors lead you to surrender and acceptance, and the universe may have stopped you for internal growth.

story.title: The Silent Wisdom of the Hanged Man
story.description: A man hangs upside down from a tree, and the peaceful expression on his face tells him that surrender comes not from pain but from acceptance, to see the world upside down, to realize the truth from a new perspective.
story.historytitle: Historical Origin: Enlightenment in the Tree of Wisdom
story.history_message: In medieval tarots, this card meant voluntary pause, not sacrifice.
story.mystic_title: Spiritual Meaning - The Power of Surrender
story.mystic_message: The Hanged Man teaches that when he chooses to accept it instead of resistance, he can achieve inner peace, sometimes spiritual awakening is hidden in waiting.
story.cultural_message: Today, this card is related to personal awareness, conscious pause, and courage to leave old patterns.
story.lesson: Stopping is not a weakness, but the preparation of rebirth, and sometimes doing nothing is the wisest act.

keywords.keywords_message: The hanging man means tarot, the hanged man, the derivative, tarot surrender, tarot awareness, tarot patience, tarot new perspective
keywords.positive_message: Surrender, awareness, inner peace, acceptance, intuitive wisdom.
keywords.balance_message: Take pause not as punishment, but as a gift of awareness.
keywords.soul_message: Inner surrender opens the gates of divine wisdom, and when you leave, you are free.

death.name: Death ‚ñ™ Transformation, Regeneration and Rebirth
death.short_description: The death card is not the end, but the door to transformation, the time to let go of the old, to free yourself from the chains of the past, and to be born into a new stage of life.

upright.general: The death card represents an important turning point and a radical change in your life, and as an old era comes to an end, a new consciousness is born, rather than physical death, a spiritual transformation and rebirth energy, which calls for the courage to let go of things that no longer serve you.
upright.love: In love, a relationship or an emotional cycle may have to end or change, after what's over, a more authentic love can arise.
upright.career: It carries an important career closure, a change of mission, or a new beginning energy, and now your old business style or goals can change.
upright.money: Financially, it's the end of the old order, the time for restructuring, transforming your budget, or moving towards different revenue sources.
upright.spiritual: Spiritually, death is the dissolution of the ego and the rebirth of the essence, and in order to get close to your true self, you have to give up the old identities.

reversed.general: The reverse death card shows resistance to change, resistance to the past, and the harder you resist, the harder my transformation becomes.
reversed.love: In reverse position in love, it points to the inability to break, to cling to old emotions, or to reject transformation.
reversed.career: Resistance to change in the field of careers can cause a blockage, and it's time to set a new course.
reversed.money: In financial matters, maintaining old habits can cause financial instability.
reversed.spiritual: Spiritually, not leaving the old patterns of faith prevents growth. The real transformation begins with surrender.

context.mythology: The death card is related to the myths of Anubis, the deity god of transformation, whose souls carry to the other world, and also to be reborn from the ashes by burning, like the bird of Phoenix. Death is not the end, but the gate.

celtic_cross.future: Soon, a period of closure and spiritual renewal will begin, bearing the seed of a new beginning.
celtic_cross.hidden_influences: Universal energy is trying to rid you of old patterns, accept transformation instead of resistance.

story.title: The Silent Transformation of Death
story.description: As a black armoured figure moves on a horse, an old king falls on the ground, and the sun rising on the horizon is a harbinger of a new life, and each end brings the light of another beginning.
story.historytitle: Historical Origin: Death and Rebirth Archetype
story.history_message: In ancient times, death was a symbol of transition, and the dissolution of the old self leads to the evolution of the soul, which reminds of the inevitable law of the cycle of life.
story.mystic_title: Spiritual Meaning - The Holyness of Transformation
story.mystic_message: The death card is the teaching of surrender and rebirth, each loss opens up a space for purer energy, and your soul prepares for rebirth.
story.cultural_message: In today's world, this card shows that it is time to give up old identities, relationships, or patterns of thought, and the void is the womb of rebirth.
story.lesson: The real transformation begins when you can honor and release the past, and the end is only the door to another beginning.

keywords.keywords_message: Death is tarot meaning, death is tarot, tarot is transformation, tarot is rebirth, tarot is end, tarot is leave
keywords.positive_message: Transformation, regeneration, awareness, cleansing, rebirth.
keywords.balance_message: Don't be afraid of ending, every ending is part of a spiritual rebirth.

temperance.name: Balance, Patience, and Inner Integration
temperance.short_description: The balance card represents combining the different energies of life in harmony and finding inner peace, a guide to the journey of patience, measurement and healing.

upright.general: The balance card is the call to find the harmony of internal and external energy, to surrender to the flow of life and to be patient, to avoid extremes, to take the middle path and trust in internal guidance. This card reminds of the importance of taking steps patiently and directing energy with consciousness.
upright.love: In love, it represents harmony, understanding, and mutual respect, the right time to find balance in a relationship, to use emotional and mental energy in harmony, and if you are single, there may be an opportunity for a balanced and mature relationship.
upright.career: In careers, business and projects, strategy, co-operation and moderate action are in the forefront, adapting in team work and balanced use of resources brings success.
upright.money: Financially, it's important to balance revenues and costs, planned investments and savings, avoid sudden spending and manage your budget consciously.
upright.spiritual: Spiritually, it teaches balance, meditation, energy studies, and inner harmony with rituals, choosing the middle path between the two ends, bringing spiritual integrity and healing.

reversed.general: It's a warning about inverse balance, incompatibility, insufferability, or extremities, a risk of losing balance, hasty behavior, or not being in control.
reversed.love: In reverse positions in love, conflict, unstable relationships or lack of communication, find common ground and be patient.
reversed.career: In a career, the reverse balance, lack of co-operation, the risk of unplanned action or misuse of resources, strategy and measurement are essential.
reversed.money: In financial matters, it's a warning of excessive spending or unplanned investment, to restore balance and to reschedule.
reversed.spiritual: Spiritually, it shows reverse positions, internal unrest, lack of meditation, and energy blocks, which require awareness to restore balance.

context.mythology: The balance card is associated with the symbols of Hermes/Mercury (hermes/Mercury) and Greek middle-way philosophy, which reminds of the universal laws of balance, balance, balance, and harmony in mythology.

celtic_cross.future: In the future, it will be important to maintain internal and external harmony, to take moderate and conscious steps in your decisions.
celtic_cross.hidden_influences: Your energies and past experiences support your finding a middle ground, so be patient and aware.

story.title: The Silent Dance of the Balance Card
story.description: An angel stands one foot in the water and passes liquid between two glasses. This represents the harmony and continuity of different energies. Every movement is conscious, every step is measured; patience and harmony guides.
story.history_message: The balance card represents the medium path, measurement, and inner harmony themes. In versions of Tarot's history, it represents the angel figure, the conscious balance, and the harmony of energy.
story.mystic_message: Balance teaches us to balance between two opposite energies, to be patient and to act with consciousness, to bring harmony and healing spiritually.
story.cultural_message: Today, the Balance represents being patient and measured in different areas of life, managing resources properly, and adapting energy.
story.lesson: Patience and balance in the course of life are the key to long - term success and spiritual peace.

keywords.positive_message: Harmony, patience, measurement, conscious movement, spiritual healing, energy balance.
keywords.balance_message: Avoid extremism and haste; manage their energy consciously.
keywords.soul_message: Find inner harmony, move forward patiently and strengthen your spiritual integrity.

the-devil.name: Satan's addiction, Shadow and Freedom
the-devil.short_description: The Devil's Card reveals inner shadows, addictions, and restrictive energy in his life, a call for awareness and consciousness to be liberated.

upright.general: The Devil's card represents confronting our shadowy parts, addictions and uncontrollable desires, which can limit your fears and habits; acting consciously and consciously will free you from your chains.
upright.love: In love, it's a warning about obsession, addiction, or controlling relationships, you have to manage emotional ties with awareness and set healthy boundaries.
upright.career: In the field of careers, attention to power struggles, manipulation or unethical behavior, instead of drifting, choose with consciousness and apply your own values.
upright.money: In financial matters, the risk of overexpension, addiction, or misuse of resources is to be planned and maintain financial freedom.
upright.spiritual: In a spiritual sense, it's an opportunity to explore the shadow side, to recognize addictions, and to free the self-restricting beliefs.

reversed.general: The Reverse Devil shows that awareness is increasing, that addictions and shadows are beginning to unravel, and the process of getting rid of the chains and liberation is progressing.
reversed.love: A chance to be free in relationships, to get away from addiction and obsession, to set up healthy boundaries.
reversed.career: It's time to get away from manipulations in business and projects, make ethical and conscious decisions.
reversed.money: It's a chance for financial liberalisation and a chance to use resources in charge, so stay away from overexpensive spending.
reversed.spiritual: Psychologically, the process of confronting shadows and letting go of addictions is progressing, trusting internal guidance.

context.mythology: The Devil's Card is associated with Baphomet and other esoteric figures, representing the shadow of human nature, desire and awareness of boundaries.

celtic_cross.future: In the future, you'll have the opportunity to face addictions or restrictive situations and be free.
celtic_cross.hidden_influences: Secret dependencies around you or within you are driving you unconsciously, consciously notice and take control.

story.title: The Shadow Dance of the Devil's Card
story.description: A figure dominates two people in chains; it binds them with dark and attractive energy; but chains are loose and freeing; this card is a symbol of recognizing shadows, releasing addictions, and freeing consciousness.
story.history_message: The Devil's Card represents desires, addictions and the dark side of human nature in medieval and Renaissance tarots, associated with Baphomet and other esoteric symbols.
story.mystic_message: Satan teaches us to face our shadow sides, to recognize addictions, and to be consciously liberated, so use your inner healing power and get rid of your chains.
story.cultural_message: Today, Satan is associated with addiction, challenging behavior, and the need to cross borders. With awareness and consciousness, it is possible to break these chains.
story.lesson: Dealing with addiction, fear, and shadow is the way to be free and truly strong.

keywords.positive_message: Awareness, liberation, awareness of the shadow, conscious choice, overstepping the bounds.
keywords.balance_message: Watch out for addictions, fears, extremes.
keywords.soul_message: Notice the shadow, release the addictions and embrace your freedom.

the-tower.name: Tower ‚ñ™ Demolition, Sudden Change and Facing Reality
the-tower.short_description: The tower card represents unexpected changes, destruction, and facing the realities of life, a time of sudden awareness and transformation.

upright.general: The tower represents the sudden changes and unexpected events in its life, the collapse of old structures, the collapse of false beliefs and supposedly safe situations, which, painfully enough, bring freedom and real awareness in the long term.
upright.love: In love, the Tower means to be questioned by shocking developments or the basis of the relationship, revealing false trusts and flings in a relationship, which is an opportunity to see the truth and rebuild it if necessary.
upright.career: In the career, there may be sudden changes in projects, unexpected obstacles or plans to collapse, which calls for building stronger and more conscious structures.
upright.money: In financial matters, sudden losses or unexpected expenses can be seen, review financial planning, use your power to turn crises into opportunities.
upright.spiritual: In a spiritual sense, the Tower recommends confronting ego, illusions, and old beliefs, opening the door for destruction, new awareness, and spiritual transformation.

reversed.general: The Reverse Tower shows that the effects of destruction can be eased or avoided. The awareness is increasing; it is possible to take precautions before protecting or destroying old structures.
reversed.love: Avoiding sudden changes or crises in a relationship means strengthening communication and acting with awareness.
reversed.career: In projects, it is possible to notice problems early and minimize the destructive effects. Planning and harmony are important.
reversed.money: Be careful to anticipate financial crises and reduce the risks. It's possible to avoid unexpected changes.
reversed.spiritual: In a spiritual sense, the process of transforming old beliefs eases or pre-recognising the crisis prevents the crisis.

context.mythology: The tower is associated with the lightnings of Zeus, the legend of Babylon's Tower, and the mythological destruction, and divine intervention symbolizes the face of man's pride and false beliefs.

celtic_cross.future: In the future, unexpected events and changes await you; old structures will fall and new awareness will arise.
celtic_cross.hidden_influences: Insecurities and false beliefs around you or within you can trigger unexpected events.

story.title: The Destruction and Enlightenment of the Tower
story.description: The tower is torn apart by lightning; as people fall, lightning and light bursts in the sky. It represents destruction, chaos and fear, but it also opens the door to awareness and freedom. It serves to destroy egos and illusions, to reach the truth and the essence of the soul.
story.history_message: The tower card represents the destruction of pride and illusions in Renaissance tarots, depicting lightning, divine intervention and the shock of truth.
story.mystic_message: The tower is a call for spiritual awakening, to face illusions and to reconstitute with consciousness, which is necessary for painful destruction, new awareness and liberation.
story.cultural_title: Modern Comment: Sudden Change and Awareness
story.cultural_message: Today, the Tower is associated with sudden crises, unexpected losses, or life-shattering developments, and it is possible to come out of these processes with awareness and consciousness.
story.lesson: Demolition, chaos, and unexpected change are inevitable parts of spiritual and personal development.

keywords.positive_message: Awareness, learning from the crisis, liberation, facing facts, transformation.
keywords.balance_message: Prepare for sudden changes and crises; act consciously instead of panic.
keywords.soul_message: Leave the old structures, see the facts and rebuild them with consciousness.

the-star.name: Star ‚ñ™ Hope, Inspiration and Spiritual Healing
the-star.short_description: The star card is a symbol of hope, innovation and inspiration, which represents spiritual healing and a safe view of the future.

upright.general: The star is a symbol of hope and inspiration followed by darkness, following the light of inner guidance, in the time of spiritual and personal renewal, discovering confidence in yourself and the universe, inner peace and balance.
upright.love: In love, the Star brings intimacy, transparency and hope, communication and trust come from the heart, and it's possible to heal in a new relationship or in the current bond.
upright.career: On its way to the career, Star shows that inspiration, creativity and vision are at the forefront, and there are opportunities in creative projects for success and the implementation of new ideas.
upright.money: Financial balance can be achieved in material matters, through hope and planning, and confidence and intuition of the future directs the right investments and steps.
upright.spiritual: In a spiritual sense, the Star represents healing, inner enlightenment, and universal connection, meditation, intentional work and intuition strengthen spiritual development.

reversed.general: Reverse Star points to despair, disappointment, or loss of direction, rethink your hopes and focus on getting better with small steps.
reversed.love: There may be a lack of trust or communication issues in the relationship, so balance it with patience and open communication.
reversed.career: There may be a loss of motivation or lack of inspiration in the career.
reversed.money: There is a risk of anxiety and uncertainty in material matters, and it is important to act planned and consciously.
reversed.spiritual: It could be a sense of dissociativeness or a lack of healing, reconnect with meditation and awareness.

context.mythology: The star card is associated with Venus and stars in mythology, with light of hope and guidance, known in ancient times as guiding light; it guides in the dark.

celtic_cross.future: In the future, hope, inspiration, and spiritual guidance await you.
celtic_cross.hidden_influences: The positive energy and intuition around you, or within you, guide your decisions and your development.

story.title: Starlight and Regeneration
story.description: A woman pours water into the water in the light of a shining star in the sky; it represents spiritual healing and regeneration. Light guides and carries hope in darkness. It reminds her of trust in the heart and soul; every drop carries energy and healing.
story.history_message: The star card is depicted as a symbol of hope and guidance in Renaissance tarots, and stars guide the future as a symbol of navigation and light.
story.mystic_message: The star is a call for access to spiritual healing, inspiration and universal guidance, to increase inner light with meditation and intent, to feel hope and balance.
story.cultural_message: Today, the Star represents spiritual and personal development through motivation, hope, and inspiring projects, and notice your own light and guide others.
story.lesson: The star teaches you to be reborn with hope, healing, and inspiration. Trust in yourself, follow your inner guidance, and find your light in the dark.

keywords.positive_message: Hope, inspiration, healing, renewal, guidance, inner peace, spiritual balance.
keywords.balance_message: When you feel disappointment or despair, remember the light and guidance, step by step.
keywords.soul_message: Follow your inner light, hope and accept spiritual healing.

the-moon.name: Moon, Subliminal, Intuitive and Mystery
the-moon.short_description: The Moon Card is a symbol of unknown, intuitive and mysterious energy, which points to awareness and internal guidance on spiritual journeys.

upright.general: The moon is the card of subconscious, intuition and mysterious processes, facing invisible forces and emotional fluctuations, listen to your inner voice, trust your intuition, and don't be afraid to face the unknown.
upright.love: In love, the Moon represents emotional complexity and unknowns, and trust in your intuition, there may be hidden feelings or uncertainty in relationships.
upright.career: There may be uncertainty and hidden interactions in your career, so follow your clues carefully and use your intuition as a guide.
upright.money: Given the risks and unknown factors, act intuitively.
upright.spiritual: On the spiritual journey, the Moon is associated with subconscious exploration and dream studies, which increase meditation, symbols, and inner observation spiritual awareness.

reversed.general: The Reverse Moon means delusions, confusion and lack of intuition, so be careful to see the facts clearly, stay alert to misleading situations.
reversed.love: In relationships, there may be privacy, uncertainty, or misunderstandings, open communication and intuition.
reversed.career: In a career, uncertainty or misdirection may pose a risk, so focus on clear information and reliable resources.
reversed.money: Financial ambiguities and false predictions can be seen.
reversed.spiritual: Spiritually, it may be about being trapped in internal guidance or being delusional, but notice your inner light and intuition.

context.mythology: The Moon card is associated with Artemis/Diana and Hecate in mythology. The moon illuminates the night, represents the subconscious and intuition; it provides guidance in the dark.

celtic_cross.future: In the future, subconscious and intuitive awareness will guide you, emotions and internal messages can affect your decisions.
celtic_cross.hidden_influences: Secret fears, subconscious influences, and intuitive information shapes the progress of your life.

story.title: The Mystery Journey of the Moon
story.description: As the moon shines in the night sky, the moon rises between two dogs and a boar, the moonlight illuminates the hidden pathways and opens the doors to the subconscious, teaching the unknown to step into the unknown, to listen to intuition, and to notice the shadows.
story.history_message: The Moon Card was painted in Renaissance tarots as a subconscious, dream and intuition card, a guide in the dark.
story.mystic_message: The moon enhances spiritual awareness in the guidance of subconscious exploration, dreams and symbols, and with meditation and internal observation, intuition is strengthened.
story.cultural_title: Modern Comment: Mystery and Internal Reconnaissance
story.cultural_message: In the modern world, the Moon is associated with subconscious processes, emotional awareness and spiritual guidance.
story.lesson: The moon teaches you to discover mystery, intuition, and subconsciousness, don't be afraid of the dark; follow the light and rely on your inner guidance.

keywords.keywords_message: the tarot meaning, the moon tarot, the subliminal, intuition, mystery, spiritual awareness, tarot dream
keywords.positive_message: Intuition, subconscious awareness, inner discovery, mysterious journey, spiritual guidance.
keywords.balance_message: Avoid delusions, use intuition, and be balanced when facing the unknown.

the-sun.name: Sun Success, Joy and Enlightenment
the-sun.short_description: The sun's card represents the bright, shining moments of life and the joy of pure life, heralding success, clarity, and a warm inner healing.

upright.general: The sun represents clarity and success after darkness. The challenges behind the curtain of its life now light up; the labors become visible. This period is a time when self-confidence will increase, creativity will be revealed, and their goals will become concrete results. The child's laughter, such as the movie scene, has a vivid, bright, rhythmic sense of happiness.
upright.love: In love, the Sun represents mutual joy, openness, and healthy sharing, and the relationship becomes a more clear, intimate form, celebrating life, and if you're single, you have a good chance of creating new ties with attractive, confident energy, and the sun sheds light on the daily rhythm of love.
upright.career: In a career, the Sun means success, recognition, and a flash of projects, a rich time for presentations, launches, or promotions, and your creative ideas will be appreciated, embodying the results while providing leadership and positive motivation within the team.
upright.money: In a material sense, the Sun is a sign of abundance and flow; the right steps, measured risks, and positive energy support financial stability. Your sources of income can be strengthened; celebrate the flow; but don't forget simplicity and wisdom in spending.
upright.spiritual: In the spiritual realm, the sun brings enlightenment, healing, and pure awareness, and you will act in harmony with your inner guide, which will make you feel more whole, and the solar energy that stimulates your inner healer, and helps you to accompany the rhythm of life with joy.

reversed.general: The Reverse Sun can point to a temporary loss of hope, inner fears that cast a shadow of confidence or success. The outside light is not extinguished; clean your inner lens and start to shine again, noticing small victories.
reversed.love: In a relationship, the opposite position, lack of communication, or expectation may create incompatibility. A little patience and transparency brings back solar energy.
reversed.career: In a career, the reverse Sun can mean lack of appreciation or delayed rewards, re-establishing your strategy to make yourself visible; success can be permanent, even if it delays.
reversed.money: Financially, the inverse situation may show misconsequential spending or lack of plans due to extreme optimism. Review your budget, use the light balanced.
reversed.spiritual: Psychologically short-term fluctuations, it's normal to feel energy diminishing, rest, recharge, and recall your light with minor rituals.

context.mythology: In ancient mythology, the sun is associated with the gods, such as Ra, Helios, or Mitra, who give days and days of life, the dawn of the sun, the glory after darkness, the brilliant memory of a hero on stage.

celtic_cross.future: In the near future, your efforts can bear fruit - visible success and social approval - opportunities to bring light to the stage.
celtic_cross.hidden_influences: Secret support, past investments or small steps may have prepared you for the present flash, your ability to reflect on the outside world.

story.title: The Sun's Scene ‚ñ™ A Film Square
story.description: In the middle of the spotlight, a figure runs with a smile in the golden light of a warm morning. In the background, children's laughter, a warm wind rising from the fields; in everyone's face, the camera slowly approaches and the simple, deep truth comes out: life exists to be celebrated. This is the scene where small victories are carried out like a big movie.
story.historytitle: Historical Origin: Sun and Life - Giving
story.history_message: Solar images are associated with life and celebration in ancient civilizations, with the number XIX tradition, enlightenment, childhood joy and fertility.
story.mystic_title: Spiritual Meaning - The Healing of Light
story.mystic_message: The sun raises the vibration of the soul, bringing healing, energy, and clarity, and the sun after darkness illuminates the inner shadows and offers a healing rhythm.
story.cultural_title: Modern Comment: Success and Daily Joy
story.cultural_message: Today, the Sun is a symbol of performance, appearance, positive brand and personal success, but the most valuable thing is to celebrate it with simple joy and gratitude.
story.lesson: The sun reminds us of the simple truth: everything is ready for you to shine. Now smile, share, and scatter your light generously.

keywords.positive_message: Joy, success, clarity, confidence, creativity, healing, and abundance.
keywords.balance_message: Avoid too much pride or pomp; humbly celebrate and share your success.
keywords.soul_message: Accept your light, joy and healing flow out of your heart, and little happiness feeds your soul.

judgment.name: Apocalypse ‚ñ™ Awakening, Awareness and Rebirth
judgment.short_description: The apocalypse is a symbol of spiritual awakening, of facing the past, of rebirth, of listening to your inner voice, and of a new era.

upright.general: The apocalypse represents a moment of great awareness, a time to face the shadows of the past, to learn from mistakes and to rise to a new level of consciousness, which symbolizes a curtain that closes the cycle of life and the rebirth of the soul, and now you are free from the burdens of the past.
upright.love: In love, the Apocalypse brings the energy to reassess the relationship, to forgive or to turn over a new page. The old heart wounds heal; the relationship can be moved to a more conscious dimension.
upright.career: In your career, you've entered a period where past experiences guide you, where there's a new beginning or change of direction, and learning from mistakes will make you grow.
upright.money: It's time to learn from past financial mistakes and take responsibility, and you're getting clarity to come up with a new plan.
upright.spiritual: Spiritually, the Doomsday card represents a deep awakening, the dissolution of karma and the rise of consciousness, a call to leave behind your former identity and wake up to the truth.

reversed.general: The reverse apocalypse can show you how to dwell in the past, regret and not forgive, the door to spiritual awakening is open, but you hesitate to step forward.
reversed.love: In love, there may be a tendency for forgiveness or past resentments, and forgiveness brings inner freedom.
reversed.career: When you don't learn from past mistakes in your career, similar cycles can be repeated.
reversed.money: The weight of the financial past may still affect you, but it's time to restructure debts or old plans.
reversed.spiritual: You may find it difficult to make peace with the past spiritually, accept rebirth with the practice of meditation and awareness.

context.mythology: The apocalypse card is associated with the trumpet of the angel Gabriel, with the mythological scenes in which the human spirits are awakened, the spiritual awakening, forgiveness, and the power of a second chance.

celtic_cross.future: In the near future, great awareness or spiritual awakening awaits you, facing the past will set you free.
celtic_cross.hidden_influences: Mixed cycles and spiritual guidance are effective in your life, so listen to your inner voice, the direction is already whispered to you.

story.title: The Call of the Apocalypse ‚ñ™ The Rebirth of the Spirit
story.description: An angel plays his trumpet from the sky, and people rise from their graves. This scene is not the birth of death, but the birth of awareness. Spirits leave their past burdens behind and walk into the light. This card is the story of a new act of life. Like an inner film scene, the awakening begins in the heart of light.
story.historytitle: Historical Origin: The Sound of Trumpet
story.history_message: In medieval tarots, the Apocalypse is a symbol of divine judgment and rebirth, and the trumpet represents the call of truth and the sound of awareness.
story.mystic_message: The apocalypse tells of reconciliation with the past and the rebirth of the soul, and hearing its inner voice opens the door to truth.
story.cultural_message: Today, the Apocalypse is associated with transformation, awareness, and personal reconstruction.
story.lesson: The apocalypse card is the teaching of forgiving the past, being born again consciously, and choosing the direction of life consciously.

keywords.keywords_message: The apocalypse is tarot, judgment tarot, tarot, awakening, rebirth, awareness, forgiveness.
keywords.positive_message: Dawning, forgiveness, rebirth, awareness, inner call, transformation.
keywords.balance_message: Let go of the past and turn a new leaf with awareness, resistance, change will set you free.
keywords.soul_message: The spiritual rebirth begins, listen to your inner call and leave the past with love.

the-world.name: World Complete, Fully and Universal Harmony
the-world.short_description: The Earth Card represents a successful completion of a cycle, integrity, and spiritual harmony, a time to achieve a universal balance and to reap the fruits of the journey.

upright.general: The world card represents the culmination of the journey, the completion of the processes you've been working on for so long, is crowned with inner peace and a sense of success, a symbol of both personal and spiritual balance, maturity and integrity, and now the wisdom of the journey is with you.
upright.love: In love, the world represents a complete bond, a soul mate, or a mature relationship, and if you're single, the past cycles close; your heart is ready for a new sleep.
upright.career: It's time to reap the fruit of your long-term efforts in your career, and projects that lead to recognition, promotion, or success, you can pass a new era consciously.
upright.money: Financial stability and long-term achievements, in a financial sense, and trust in the flow; it pays off their efforts.
upright.spiritual: Spiritually, the Earth is a symbol of completion, integrity and unity, and you've learned your spiritual lessons, and now you're in harmony with the universe.

reversed.general: The Reverse World points to loose ends, unfinished cycles, or feelings of dissatisfaction, and to close the process, we need a final step of awareness.
reversed.love: The opposite position in love can indicate the fact that you're under the influence of a past bond or that you can't complete the emotional cycle.
reversed.career: One final step in the career or the project is waiting to be completed.
reversed.money: You are financially close to the goal; a small arrangement or patient completion occurs.
reversed.spiritual: Spiritually, the cycle is about to close; it is necessary to fully understand the lessons, to integrate awareness.

context.mythology: The Earth Card is associated with the combination of the Ouroboros and the four elements that eat its own tail. This represents the infinite cycle, the integrity of life, and the universal balance of the soul.

celtic_cross.future: In the near future, the energy of completion and success will prevail, and you will receive the reward of your efforts, and you will step into a new cycle consciously.
celtic_cross.hidden_influences: You're in a time when the universe is working in harmony with you, and everything fits together as a whole.

story.title: World Dance ‚ñ™ Universal Harmony
story.description: A female figure dances in a circle in the middle of the sky. She holds two wands in her hand; four elements, four seasons and four directions are balanced around her. This scene represents the sacred moment when the journey is recognized, not the end of the journey, but the wholeness. The Earth card is a symbol of the unity and peace.
story.history_message: The world is a symbol of universal harmony and spiritual maturity in Renaissance tarots, the closure of a cycle, the beginning of a new life.
story.mystic_message: The world tells of the harmony of the soul with the universe, and now you know the great cycle of life; what you start and what you end, you just exist.
story.cultural_title: Modern Comment: Completion and Global Consciousness
story.cultural_message: Today, the Earth card is associated with success, awareness, universal connection and global harmony, becoming the collective power of individual efforts.
story.lesson: The world is the reward of travel: balance, integrity and peace, instead of fear of completion, step into the new cycle with gratitude.

keywords.keywords_message: The tarot meaning of the world is the world tarot, completeness, integrity, balance, harmony, success, spiritual maturity.
keywords.positive_message: Completion, balance, success, integrity, harmony, confidence, gratitude.
keywords.balance_message: Don't go back until you've shut down a cycle; rely on the natural rhythm of processes.
keywords.soul_message: You are in universal balance, honor completion, and prepare with love for new beginnings.

ace-of-wands.name: Asa's Ace ‚ñ™ Creative Beginnings and Inspiration
ace-of-wands.short_description: The ace of the staff is a symbol of inspiration, creative energy and new beginnings, and with your internal healer guidance, explore your passion and make your potential concrete.

upright.general: The wand represents the beginning of new ideas, projects and creative opportunities. Your energy is high, your motivation is strong; now it's time to act and turn your intentions into an epiphany. With your internal guidance, you transfer your passion and creativity into your life.
upright.love: In love, the Ace of the Wand represents exciting beginnings and passionate interactions, an inspired time to start a new relationship or to add life to the current relationship.
upright.career: There are opportunities for creative projects and initiatives in the field of careers, and it's a good time to take new steps with inspiration and courage, turn your ideas into action and organize your plans.
upright.money: Financially, Asa Asi means new income opportunities and creative solutions. When you take risks, trust your intuition; innovative approaches can bring profit.
upright.spiritual: Spiritually, the Ace of Asa represents the beginning of spiritual growth and awareness with inspiration and internal energy, activating your inner power with meditation and creative rituals.

reversed.general: The Reverse Asa Ace shows a lack of motivation or a lack of motivation or a lack of ability to begin, refocusing your energy with patience and planning.
reversed.love: Inverse position in love points to the risk of obstruction or a decrease in passion at the beginning of a relationship. It is important to establish open communication and intent.
reversed.career: The Reverse Ace of the Career may not come to life, or there may be delays in projects, first form a strategy, then step forward.
reversed.money: Financially, there's a risk of not seeing opportunities or hasty decisions.
reversed.spiritual: The opposite position in a spiritual sense shows situations where energy and inspiration are undirected, reconnected with meditation and intentional studies.

context.mythology: The wand is associated with the element of creativity and fire, which is associated with creative inspiration, new beginnings and the journeys of heroes, seen as inspirational figures, as guides to energy and passion.

celtic_cross.future: In the future, there will be new projects and creative opportunities, step forward with courage and direct your energy.
celtic_cross.hidden_influences: The hidden effects are from internal motivation and supportive environment.

story.title: Asa's Ace ‚ñ™ The Birth of Inspiration and Creative Energy
story.description: The wand represents fresh energy and inspiration, like a flame rising from the hand, which shows the time for invitation and creative potential to be activated for new beginnings, and with your internal healer guidance turn your passions into action.
story.history_message: In the history of Tarot, the wand has been portrayed as a new beginnings and creative energy card, representing potential and inspiration with a figure of flame or staff that has been released in Renaissance and Middle Ages cards.
story.mystic_message: Spiritually, Asa's Ace represents inner inspiration, creative energy and beginnings, and through meditation and intent, transform your energy into concrete action.
story.cultural_message: In the modern world, the ace of staff represents creative initiatives, new projects, and the energy to stimulate passion, and the courage to step forward brings success.
story.lesson: The wand teaches you to recognize new beginnings, inspiration and creative energy, direct your energy, reveal your passion and potential.

keywords.positive_message: Creativity, inspiration, passion, new beginnings, energy, opportunity, initiative.
keywords.balance_message: Avoid hasty steps or unplanned beginnings; focus your energy.
keywords.soul_message: Notice your inner inspiration and motivation, embody your potential.

two-of-wands.name: Asa Two to Plan and Enlarge Potential
two-of-wands.short_description: Asa Two is the energy to explore vision, strategy, and new opportunities, and with your internal healer guidance, expand your creative potential and make your plans concrete.

upright.general: Asa Two represent the time to expand your vision, make long-term plans and take strategic steps. You are in a good time to make decisions, assess options and optimize your potential. By relying on your internal guidance, take creative and logical steps.
upright.love: In love, Asa Two mean future plans in relationships, serious steps or choices, and use your intuition and communication to make mutual decisions and to take the relationship to a new level.
upright.career: In career, it's time for strategic planning, organizing projects and focusing on long-term goals, taking potential opportunities and taking steps consciously, your vision for the future is important.
upright.money: Financially, investments, budget planning and the right assessment of opportunities are prerequisite.
upright.spiritual: Spiritually, Asa Two represent progress through internal guidance and vision, expanding spiritual potential with meditation, vision studies and intentional actions.

reversed.general: Two Reverse Asas point to the risk of uncertainty, uncertainty, or misapprehension of opportunity.
reversed.love: In love, there may be reverse positions, confusion in relationship decisions, missteps, communication and open intent.
reversed.career: Two of them in reverse careers mean lack of planning or delay in projects.
reversed.money: Financially, there's a risk of wrong investment or rash decision.
reversed.spiritual: It's a psychologically reversed position, vision, and a lack of guidance, re-establish internal focus.

context.mythology: In mythology, the Asa Two represent the hero's path distinction and discovery energy in relation to new horizons and options, linked to the journey and the conscious decision-making archetype.

celtic_cross.future: In the future, important choices and plans will be on the agenda, so intuition and analysis must be used together.
celtic_cross.hidden_influences: Secret effects are potential opportunities and strategic support.

story.title: Asa Two - Enlarge the horizons
story.description: Asa Two is a symbol of the person holding a world map in one hand. This person examines the options ahead of him and makes plans for the future. The card represents looking at new opportunities, strategic thinking and turning creative potential into action. With internal healer guidance, you can make conscious and visionary decisions.
story.history_message: In the history of Tarot, the Asa Two were painted as a vision, decision-making card, and in Renaissance and medieval cards, a person thinks about the future and the options as he studies the horizon.
story.mystic_message: Spiritually, Asa Two teach you to explore your potential through internal guidance and vision, determine your intentions and take conscious steps.
story.cultural_message: In the modern world, Asa Two represent strategic thinking, planning, and choosing the most appropriate way to think about careers, relationships, and projects.
story.lesson: The Asa Two teach you to expand your vision, to evaluate options, to make conscious decisions, to optimize your potential and rely on internal guidance.

three-of-wands.name: The Three of the Asa (the Three) The Development and Enlargement of Opportunities
three-of-wands.short_description: The Three of Asa are a card to implement your vision, to expand long-term plans and explore opportunities, and with your internal healer guidance, move forward and strengthen your strategic steps.

upright.general: The three of Asa represent the period when they see the fruit of their efforts, evaluate new opportunities, and consolidate their vision. When they take patient and conscious steps, their plans become a success. Think strategically about the future and clearly consider your options.
upright.love: In love, three Asas mean new horizons, long-term goals and common plans. Communication and vision are important to move forward your current relationship or to establish a new connection.
upright.career: In careers, projects come to the stage of growth and expansion, and it's an ideal time to see business opportunities, to strengthen their cooperation and to make strategic moves, and new responsibilities or leadership roles can come up.
upright.money: Financially, it's time to increase investments and resources, with planned steps and accurate analysis, to max out opportunities, with new revenue routes or co-operation, the financial situation can be strengthened.
upright.spiritual: Spiritually, the three of Asa represent the transformation of vision and intent into concrete results.

reversed.general: The Reverse Asa three represent opportunities, lack of planning, or unexpected obstacles, so be patient, review your strategy, and don't make rash decisions.
reversed.love: In love, the opposite position means lack of communication, false expectations, or a blockage of plans for the future, open communication and harmony are essential.
reversed.career: In the career, the Reverse Asa Three indicate delays in projects, lack of opportunity or lack of co-operation. Reorganise plans.
reversed.money: Financially, pay attention to misinvestments or unexpected losses.
reversed.spiritual: Spiritually inverted position represents ignoring vision or guidance, regaining inner focus.

context.mythology: The three of them are linked to the energy of travel, exploration and expansion in mythology, the hero's step into the new land, his discovery of opportunities, and his application of his vision.

celtic_cross.future: In the future, it will be possible to expand your plans, take new opportunities, and make strategic moves.
celtic_cross.hidden_influences: The hidden effects are resources and unexpected opportunities that support the consequences of current efforts.

story.title: Three of the Asa (The Opportunities Beyond the horizon)
story.description: One figure on the Asa card, and he looks at the sea and sees three staffs; he represents new horizons and opportunities. This person is ready to bring his vision to life. The card teaches him to think strategic thoughts, to evaluate patience and opportunities at the right time. With your internal healer guidance, it's time to make your dreams come true.
story.history_message: The three of them are seen as cards of progress, expansion and opportunity in Tarot's history. In the Renaissance deck, the figure is described as studying new lands and opportunities.
story.mystic_message: Spiritually, the three of Asa teach vision and intent to transform into concrete acts.
story.cultural_message: In the modern world, the three of Asa mean seeing opportunities in careers, projects and relationships, taking strategic steps and making long-term plans, and leadership and vision are important together.
story.lesson: The three of Asa teach patience, strategy, and the ability to evaluate opportunities, embody your vision and expand your potential.

keywords.positive_message: Evaluation of opportunities, vision, strategic planning, progress, long-term goals.
keywords.balance_message: An impatient or hasty decision poses a risk. Analyze the opportunities carefully.
keywords.soul_message: Make your vision concrete, take opportunities, and take conscious steps.

four-of-wands.name: Asa's Four (Celebrity, Success and Completion)
four-of-wands.short_description: The Four of Asa is a symbol of success, celebration, and safety, and with your intrinsic healer guidance, celebrate the fruit of your labor and make a stable progress.

upright.general: The Asa quartet represents a period of completion of a goal, recognition of labor, and celebration of success. This card represents progress on safe foundations, stability in business and life projects. Celebration, peace and motivation are united.
upright.love: In love, the Four of Asa brings confidence, harmony and celebration in relationships, an ideal time to share common achievements and to highlight happiness in a relationship, marriage or serious commitments may come to the agenda.
upright.career: The completion of projects in the career represents the period of co-operation with appreciation and awards, a good time to get paid for work, celebrate team achievements, and boost motivation.
upright.money: Financial stability and confidence are important, investments bear fruit and budget control. Long-term security is achieved by the balanced management of profits and resources.
upright.spiritual: Spiritually, the Asa quartet brings in inner peace, trust and celebration energy, success and completion, spiritual growth, and a chance to recognize its own healing power.

reversed.general: The Reverse Asa Four means that you can't appreciate the lack of plans, delays, or success, and it's time to postpone the celebrations and restore stability.
reversed.love: In the opposite position of love, conflict, dissonance, or lack of celebration in a relationship, communication and appreciation are important.
reversed.career: There's a risk in the career of delaying projects, incompatibility or failure to be noticed.
reversed.money: Financially inverted position points to mismanagement, instability, or spending problems.
reversed.spiritual: In a spiritual sense, a sense of completion is lacking, a lack of celebration or gratitude, restore inner peace.

context.mythology: In mythology, the Asa Four are associated with celebration, community and safe habitats, and the symbol of victory and harmony represents the results of the hero's labor and social celebrations.

celtic_cross.future: In the future, the time for success and celebration is coming, and the reward of your labor will increase your motivation.
celtic_cross.hidden_influences: The hidden effects are about the strengthening environment and the strengthening of safe foundations.

story.title: The Four of Asa, the Light of Victory and Celebration
story.description: The card is filled with the atmosphere of celebration with flowers and colorful decorations that frame its four wands, and people share and celebrate the fruits of labor, and with your inner healer guidance, both appreciate success and take safe steps towards the future.
story.history_message: The Four of Asa, known in Tarot's history as a celebration, trust and stability card, was described in the Renaissance deck by community celebrations and success scenes.
story.mystic_title: Spiritual Meaning - Know and Celebrate Success
story.mystic_message: Spiritually, the Asa quartet is about realizing success and completion, celebrating and thanking, and success is the result of internal guidance and stable effort.
story.cultural_message: In the modern world, the Asa Four means celebrating the successes of work, project, or relationship successes, integration and motivation with the community. Stability and celebration come together.
story.lesson: The Four of Asa teaches to recognize success, to celebrate, and to move on to safe foundations. Motivation and gratitude are a source of strength for new opportunities.

five-of-wands.name: Asa Five ‚ñ™ Fighting, Competition and Learning
five-of-wands.short_description: Asa Five is a symbol of conflict, competition, and differences of opinion, and by your internal healer's guidance, turn these challenges into learning opportunities and magic.

upright.general: The Five of Asa represent a period of conflict, competition and challenges, and this card advises you to notice external or internal conflicts and to turn them into learning and development opportunities, and struggles test your skills and strategy.
upright.love: In love, Asa Five shows disagreements, small arguments or competition, communication and understanding are important to maintain balance in the relationship, which can strengthen dynamics in the relationship.
upright.career: In careers, the challenge of team competition, conflict of opinion, or projects comes up, you can achieve success with cooperation, strategy and flexibility.
upright.money: Financially, we need to make careful decisions in the environment of sharing resources or competition, and hasty and uncontrollable actions can lead to casualties.
upright.spiritual: In a spiritual sense, Asa Five allows you to recognize internal conflicts and different viewpoints, which offer opportunities for conflict, spiritual maturity, and inner strength.

reversed.general: Reverse Asa Five demonstrates the growth of conflicts, the unresolved disputes, or passive behavior. It is important to find a constructive solution rather than ignore the struggles.
reversed.love: The opposite position in love, the lack of communication, or the ongoing conflict that leads to tension in the relationship. Open communication is essential.
reversed.career: The reverse Asa Five in the career points to the lack of co-operation, the failure of team problems or projects, and planning and compromise is necessary.
reversed.money: Financially inverted position is a risk of not being able to manage resources properly or being lost.
reversed.spiritual: Mentally reversed Asa Five represents suppressing internal disturbances or conflicts.

context.mythology: The Asa Five are associated with challenges, competition and heroic tests in mythology, and the test, skill and strategy of heroes is the subject of testing, overcoming challenges.

celtic_cross.future: In the future, you're going to face challenges and test your skills, which offer challenges, development and learning opportunities.
celtic_cross.hidden_influences: There can be hidden influences, rivals, different perspectives, internal conflicts, and that awareness can make you stronger.

story.title: Asa Five (The Battle and Learning Scene)
story.description: Five figures fight each other with their wands on the card, and conflict represents the opportunity of learning and magic, not chaos, and with your internal healer guidance, solve every argument and obstacle with understanding and strategy.
story.history_message: In the history of Tarot, Asa Five is known as a conflict and competition card, described in Renaissance cards by the challenges of young men or warriors.
story.mystic_message: Mentally, the Five of Asa show that adversity and conflict have an opportunity to learn and mature, gain inner strength through strategy and understanding.
story.cultural_message: In the modern world, Asa Five represent competition in business and relationships, differences of opinion, and personal trials, and struggles should be viewed as an opportunity for experience and development.
story.lesson: The Five of Asa teach to notice conflict, to learn and to grow by strategy, and competition and struggle are the source of maturity and inner strength.

keywords.positive_message: Fighting, learning, development, strategy, competition, inner power, experience.
keywords.balance_message: Lead the conflict in a constructive way, turn competition into opportunity.
keywords.soul_message: The struggle and its different viewpoints provide spiritual maturity and inner strength.

six-of-wands.name: Six of them are victorious, recognized, and successful.
six-of-wands.short_description: The six of them represent success, victory, and recognition from the environment, celebrating the achievements you have gained through your intrinsic healer guidance, and feeling inspiring progress.

upright.general: Six of them represent the era of success and recognition, and by overcoming the challenges and making efforts, you gain both internal and external victories, which is a calling to celebrate progress, leadership, and success.
upright.love: In love, six of Asa show positive progress in the relationship, appreciation, and harmony, and recognize the love and effort of the other person and focus on moving forward together.
upright.career: In the field of careers, there is success, promotion or recognition in projects, leadership and effective communication within the team, and you're being rewarded for your efforts.
upright.money: In financial matters, it is possible to increase financial success and gain, and the right investments and strategic steps produce positive results.
upright.spiritual: Spiritually, Asa Six is a self-awareness and spiritual achievement experience card. Victory is linked to inner trust and guidance.

reversed.general: Reverse Asa Six means failure to recognize success, lack of appreciation, or self-esteem, so don't underestimate yourself, notice what you've achieved.
reversed.love: It can show inverse position in love, lack of appreciation, or communication problems, balance with open communication.
reversed.career: Inverted Staff Six in a career, late detection of success, motivation represents low or jealousy, strategy and patience are needed.
reversed.money: Financially, there may be delays in income or the lack of awareness of gains.
reversed.spiritual: Spiritually inverted position means not celebrating inner glory or underestimating success.

context.mythology: The six of them are associated with mythological stories of the success of heroes and recognition of society, symbolizing the reward of victory, labor and skill.

celtic_cross.future: In the future, you will be appreciated and congratulated on your efforts, and leadership and inspiring steps will bring you forward.
celtic_cross.hidden_influences: Secret influences, supporters, mentors, or your own internal guidance can speed up success.

story.title: Six of the Asa (P.S.) The Hall of Glory and Appreciation
story.description: A figure in the card moves on a horse in front of the people as if he's won a victory. The people around him applaud it. This scene is a symbol of celebration and appreciation. Notice and celebrate the accomplishments you've achieved with your inner healer guidance.
story.history_message: Six of them are known in Tarot's history as success and recognition cards, depicting in Renaissance cards the hero or leader's victory and the applause of the public.
story.mystic_message: Spiritually, the Six of Asa teaches us to recognize the achievements achieved by your inner strength and guidance, and celebrating success increases inner stability and motivation.
story.cultural_message: In the modern world, six of Asa represent the victories and recognition achieved in careers, relationships, and personal goals, and success inspires both yourself and your environment.
story.lesson: Six of them teach us to celebrate victory, to recognize their achievements, and to increase motivation, and appreciation is the key to growth and inspiration.

keywords.positive_message: Success, victory, recognition, motivation, leadership, inner power, inspiring steps.
keywords.balance_message: Share success and be humble, and notice the contribution of others.
keywords.soul_message: Victory and appreciation strengthen both inner trust and guidance.

seven-of-wands.name: Asa Seven Fight, Defensive, and Courageous
seven-of-wands.short_description: The seven of them are the cards of endurance, of defending their rights, and of courageous progress, teaching them to stand firm against obstacles that arise with your inner healer's guidance.

upright.general: The seven of Asa show that there is a time for dealing with rivals and challenges, and it is important to stand by courage and determination, to defend and protect their rights, a symbol of fighting, to set limits, and to move forward with confidence.
upright.love: In love, Asa Seven show the need to limit a relationship, express itself and maintain its emotional space, open communication and determination form healthy bonds.
upright.career: In the field of careers, you're in a strong time to face difficulties and lead projects, and competition, obstacles, and outside pressures will only make you stronger.
upright.money: In financial matters, situations that require self-defense and determination may arise, protecting their rights, acting planned and managing risks.
upright.spiritual: Spiritually, the seven of Asa represent defending their own values and overcoming the obstacles faced on the spiritual road - courage and faith support spiritual growth.

reversed.general: The Reverse Asa Seven points to lack of courage, vulnerability, or a tendency to retreat; uncertainty and fear can grow; you must remember your limitations and your rights.
reversed.love: The opposite position in love means shyness, lack of communication, or lack of boundaries.
reversed.career: In reverse career Asa Seven is a risk of retreating from projects, avoiding competition or bowing to pressure, regain your determination.
reversed.money: Financially, there may be negative consequences if you can't defend your rights or manage the risks correctly.
reversed.spiritual: Spiritually reversed position means lack of spiritual courage and lack of inner guidance.

context.mythology: The seven of Asa are associated with mythological stories of heroics, defences, and struggle, and the archetype of heroes standing up in challenging situations and defending their rights.

celtic_cross.future: You will have to show determination and courage to face the challenges you face in the future, and resistance and defense will be critical to success.
celtic_cross.hidden_influences: Secret influences, supportive people, internal guidance or past experiences will strengthen you and prepare you for obstacles.

story.title: Asa Seven - A Story of Courage
story.description: A figure in the card stands firm in the face of rivals and obstacles, as a symbol of fighting, courage and determination, and your inner healer guidance is a guide that strengthens and guides you.
story.history_message: The seven of them are known in Tarot's history as a fighting and resistance card, and in the Middle Ages and Renaissance cards, the hero or leader's stand against adversity.
story.mystic_message: Spiritually, the seven of Asa teach them to stand fearless in the face of obstacles and to defend their own values, and to be courageous is to strengthen their inner guidance.
story.cultural_message: In the modern world, the seven of Asa represent facing challenges in careers, relationships, or personal goals and defending their rights.
story.lesson: The seven of Asa teach them to fight, to defend their rights, and to stand bold in the face of obstacles. Resistance and determination are the key to growth.

keywords.positive_message: The struggle, the resistance, the defense, the courage, the determination, the confidence, the restraints.
keywords.balance_message: Don't be too harsh or aggressive when you're fighting, be determined but balanced.
keywords.soul_message: Be brave against obstacles, trust in your inner guidance, and keep your limits.
